intro: Polylychnis fulgens, commonly known as the flame bamboo, is a striking ornamental plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tall, slender stalks and vibrant, fiery orange to red inflorescences. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense, colorful panicles, which give it its dramatic visual appeal. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Its rapid growth and showy display make it a popular choice for tropical gardens and landscapes.
